PathOfBuilding.Notes:
^2^2^2^2^2^2> CHANGES IN 3.26 <^7 - Champion changes: Ascendancy order is completely changed - Champion changes: We now get 20 fortification(up from 15) - Champion changes: Worthy Foe now only requires 1 ascendancy "level", and Conqueror has been removed/merged with Worthy Foe - Champion changes: Because of the Worthy Foe change we have an extra ascendancy, we spend this on First to Strike, Last to Fall - Added a potential cluster setup(see: Replica Dragonfang and Unnatural Instinct trees, but you can use it for other setups too)
^2> WHY ARE ONLY 3 ASCENDANCIES SELECTED? <^7 PoB hasn't been updated yet at the time of making this build, just pick up "Worthy Foe" in Cruel Lab and keep it forever.
^2> MERCENARY <^7 Not that much is known yet about how Mercenaries will actually play out. Some cheap uniques that might be good to put on it: - Shaper's Seed (life regen) - Kaom's Binding (effectively gives you physical mitigation) - Leer Cast (bit of damage)
You'll have to experiment what tradeoff between damage and utility is worth it though, and whether the party scaling the Mercenary will give in bossfights(50% more life for bosses) is even worth using at all.
^2> PLAYSTYLE <^7^7 > Clear < For clear you just place down ballistas and run around.
> Bossing < You can start a fight by having all your totems up and ready, then as soon as the boss is targetable press focus(if you need focus on your build). During the fight you want to keep to your totem limit all the time. You also want to use your frenzy setup to keep frenzy charges up. Only when you have time for it you want to cast your Arcanist Brand, this is the lowest priority since it lingers on the boss for a bit anyway.
BONUS TRICK: On bosses where there are no attacks you care about evading(like Uber Shaper, the slam can't be evaded) consider running Malevolence instead of Grace
^2> LEVELING <^7 We start out with splitting steel, you can also use spectral throw if you prefer this, the gearing is the same, except you don't use sniper's mark. Get an iron ring or two, and a rustic sash. For weapon we use a 2-handed sword or axe. If you get an essence you can throw it on your weapon to get a good upgrade, probably wait until you have a Woodsplitter(ilvl 13+) or better before you do this though. If you have enough accuracy you can take Precise Technique for that nice 40% damage boost. Really try to get this, run precision if you have to or take Weathered Hunter on the tree.
At level 28 we switch to Explosive Arrow, keep Precise Technique on the tree, even though this does not apply to ignites we're still largely hit-based at this point. Use a bow that's as fast as possible(Short Bow is nice!) since we want many stacks of Explosive Arrow. ^xAF6025Quill Rain^7 is absolutely insane combined with the Projectile Speed Bow Mastery! If you pick up Elemental Equilibrium make sure to have at least 1 lightning or/and cold damage to attacks somewhere on your gear, AND NO FIRE DAMAGE TO ATTACKS. If you found a Gemcutter's Prism you can use it on a Rain of Arrows gem and vendor it with a rare onyx amulet, normal Sharktooth Arrow Quiver and a chance orb to receive a Hyrri's Bite, which is pretty nice this early on. Make sure you DO NOT use Sniper's Mark anymore once you switched to Explosive Arrow, as this will reduce your DPS to almost nothing.
From here on out the leveling will be pretty straight forward, just follow the trees in the guide, just make sure to spec out of Precise Technique once your reach Elemental Overload or it'll never proc! Also remember to run a leveled Precision gem over Skitterbots until you have your merciless lab
^2> ADRENALINE <^7 "First to Strike, Last to Fall" on Champion gives Adrenaline if you drop below 50% hp. This will give you about 20% more damage, some movement speed and some physical damage reduction but you'll need to setup a Corrupting Fever setup in your weapon swap to proc Adrenaline reliably. Make sure your Corrupting Fever costs at least 50% of your life to consistently be able to proc Adrenaline. It's not required to keep Adrenaline up, but it's a bit of minmax you can do if you feel up to it. If you don't manually proc Adrenaline the ascendancy node is still a nice emergency heal when you get hit.
^2> WHY ONLY 20 STACKS OF FORTIFICATION? <^7 Getting more Fortify stacks is simply not worth the investment. You could consider using Celestial Brace gloves, but this makes getting 100% chance to suppress extremely hard, and this unique will likely be very expensive since it's Uber-only.
^2> WHY NOT ELEMENTALIST? <^7 While Elementalist is the highest damage ascendancy for this build, it lacks defenses and starts at a pretty awkward position on the tree to get more defenses. One of the reasons Elementalist is strong is also because of stuff like Blizzard Crown and high flat elemental damage on a +3 bow which will be relatively hard to get in a SSF environment(it scales much more with gear in general). Elementalist is definitely a valid option too, and if you want to maximize damage you should look into it, but generally people that are struggling with bosses will find Champion to be much easier to play.
^2> WHAT IF I DON'T HAVE RAIN OF SPLINTERS? <^7 Rain of Splinters is really good for clear, but it's not absolutely required. If you feel like your clear is really bad without it you can consider using Lesser or Greater Multiple Projectiles for clear and swapping it with Hypothermia on bosses(replace Elemental Damage With Attacks or Ignite Prolif(if you have prolif gloves)). You can also grab a ^xAF6025Dying Sun^7, uptime on that should be fine for clear and you don't need it for single target.
^2> GETTING BOW COLORS <^7 --> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8260_VEVhw <--
Ideally we need 5 off-colors on the bow. Bows are dex based so this is pretty hard. To fix this we use a Short Bow, this only has a dex requirement of 26, which helps a lot. But even then it'll still take well over 300 chromes to hit your desired colors. Here are some tips to make it easier to hit: - Omen of Blanching rolls 1-3 white sockets on your next chrome, you might get lucky - If you couldn't get a 6L Short Bow, or are having a lot of trouble coloring, you can replace "Elemental Damage With Attacks" with Sadism or Hypothermia. If really desperate you can replace Ignite Prolif with one of these gems too, but this will require you to roll Ignite Prolif on your gloves. - Worst case you can use Harvest non-white to white, but this is quite expensive.
^2> ELEMENTAL EQUILIBRIUM <^7 The way Elemental Equilibrium(EE from now on) works with Explosive Arrow is that the arrow part of Explosive Arrow has no fire damage by default. So if you get any cold or lightning damage to attacks anywhere on your gear, this means the arrows your ballistas shoot will apply EE(reducing fire res), then the explosion will apply EE as well(removing the fire res reduction), but shortly after an arrow will hit again(reducing fire res). Just make very sure the arrow portion of your skill doesn't apply fire damage.
^2> CRAFTING GEAR <^7 ^1> BOW <^7 --> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8260_VEVhw <--
1. Turn in a set of ^6The Porcupine^7 to get a 6L ilvl 50 Short Bow. If for some reason that Divination Card got nerfed(you never know with GGG): farm a set of ^6Imperial Legacy^7, but this will make coloring REALLY HARD. Alternatively add high ilvl Short Bows and Grove Bows to your filter and link it yourself. 2. Spam Shrieking Essences of Dread until you hit your desired attack speed roll(T1 preferably) 3. Use annulment orbs or whatever other tools you have available to get the bow to 2(or less) prefixes and 2 suffixes, while retaining the +2 to bow gems and attack speed roll 4. Craft "Cannot Roll Attack Mods" on your bow 5. Slam the item with a new mod(Exalted Orb), this always hits +1 to socketed gems 6. Recraft the crafted mod to Minion Attack/Cast Speed 7. Check out the "^2Getting Bow Colors^7" section of this guide 8. Done!
^1> JEWEL <^7 1. Pick up some Viridian Jewels 2. Use Harvest "Reforge Speed" and "Reforge Life" on it 3. Pray you hit life and attack speed 4. Done
^1> QUIVER <^7 1. Grab a Hunter Broadhead Quiver(SSF tip: you can swap influence with Harvest on any Broadhead Quiver) 2. Spam Harvest Reforge Fire until you hit Fire Damage over Time Multiplier and Damage over Time Multiplier together. This step will be expensive, especially if you go greedy and want high tier of both, consider settling for non-perfect. 3. Get the Quiver to have an open suffix and prefix using annulls. Potentially if you get an open suffix first, without having an open prefix, you can craft Cannot Roll Attack Mods before annulling to save your item from risk(assuming there is at least 1 non-attack prefix) 4. Craft suffixes cannot be changed and scour to get a clean quiver with just the 2 Damage over Time Multiplier rolls 5. Repeat these steps until satisfied with the prefixes: 5.1. Craft Cannot Roll Attack Mods 5.2. Slam exalts until happy or brick(pierce or low tier mod). Exalts here can only slam 4 mods: life, damage with bow skills, movement speed and pierce. If you hit life + damage with bow skills consider settling since pierce would brick your build. 5.3. If you bricked: annull and hope you get rid of all prefixes, if you got rid of "Cannot Roll Attack Mods" just craft "Suffixes Cannot Be Changed" and scour and restart at step 5.1. 6. Finish the Quiver by crafting attack speed
^2> COMMON MISTAKES <^7 - Make sure you have no flat fire damage anywhere, this breaks your Elemental Equilibrium - If it looks like all your arrows are missing and you see no explosions: make sure you have no pierce anywhere - Make sure you have 100% chance to ignite. Pathing on the right side of "Breath of Flames" on the skilltree gives us 30% chance to ignite, make sure you're not missing that. On setups with cluster jewels it's important to have 2 jewels with 5% chance to ignite each. - Make sure you have enough accuracy before Cruel lab, without accuracy EA will feel really bad. You can drop skitterbots and run a leveled Precision gem to fix this early on. - If you go for the Replica Dragonfang version, make sure you have at least 8% reservation efficiency on it. If you don't you can support some auras with Enlighten instead.
^2> ATTACK RATE BREAKPOINTS <
^7First of all: don't try to focus on breakpoints too much, they usually assume an ideal situation which won't happen in the real game
We want to reach 20 stacks on Explosive Arrow to get as big an ignite as possible, there's 3 ways to achieve this: - Attack rate - Totem count - Fuse duration
Getting more fuse duration will mean your clear will feel worse, so I would recommend this only as your last resort.
You can calculate approximately how many fuses you'll get using the following formula(the "+ 1" at the end is cause the fuse timer only starts once you hit your first fuse):
(attack rate x totem count x fuse duration) + 1 = fuse count

Skill.label: Frenzy and Curse (can also link Hextouch if want)
EA - Swap in Empower if prolif on gloves
Auras (Swap Grace for Malev in maps)
^1if you want you can put this in your weapon swap
Auras (Swap Grace for Malev in maps)
^1if you want you can put this in your weapon swap
